qas.question: What demand did the US make before invading Iraq in 2003?

answers.text: that Iraqi President Saddam Hussein leave Iraq

qas.question: How many US troops participated in the invasion?
What country refused to allow forces to stage within it?
How long did the first phase of fighting last?
How long did the US and its coalition partners have to occupy Iraq?

plausible_answers.text: Iraqi President Saddam Hussein leave Iraq

qas.question: What demand did the US make before invading Iraq in 2004?
How many UK troops participated in the invasion?
What country allowed forces to stage within it?
How long did the second phase of fighting last?
How long did the US and its coalition partners have to occupy Iran?

context: After the lengthy Iraq disarmament crisis culminated with an American demand <a0_0>that <b5_0>Iraqi President Saddam Hussein leave Iraq<b5_0/><a0_0/>, which was refused, a coalition led by the United States and the United Kingdom fought the Iraqi army in the 2003 invasion of Iraq. Approximately <a1_0><b6_0>250,000<b6_0/><a1_0/> United States troops, with support from 45,000 British, 2,000 Australian and 200 Polish combat forces, entered Iraq primarily through their staging area in Kuwait. (<a2_0><b7_0>Turkey<b7_0/><a2_0/> had refused to permit its territory to be used for an invasion from the north.) Coalition forces also supported Iraqi Kurdish militia, estimated to number upwards of 50,000. After <a3_0>approximately <b8_0>three weeks<b8_0/><a3_0/> of fighting, Hussein and the Ba'ath Party were forcibly removed, followed by <a4_0><b9_0>9 years<b9_0/><a4_0/> of military presence by the United States and the coalition fighting alongside the newly elected Iraqi government against various insurgent groups.
